37256583.review:
Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a bizarre, but extremely addictive experience—a deceptively simple shmup/roguelike hybrid where every fork in the road offers a wealth of random events.  Its deliberately minimalistic graphics are not only a reflection of the edutainment game it parodies, but also the old-school gameplay mechanics from which much of its difficulty is derived—only one weapon can be used at a time, and the game is programmed to only process two [i]inputs[/i] from the player at once, which leads to the quintessential choice between playing offensively or defensively...or, in other words, moving in one direction and attacking, or moving in two directions.

Does this come across as clunky sometimes?  Do the Atari-esque graphics hold it back in some regards?  Maybe.  But at a meager three dollars, the game offers a surprising amount of depth.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a light-hearted shmup experience.

33737264.review: A very fast paced parody of Organ trail that takes the American setting and makes it ... sillier? The game is side scrolling shooter with filled with permadeath and randomly generated events. It's also my favorite type of randomness, the controlled type of randomness where in every stage of the game you have multiple possibilities of events that can come up. This means you can get rng screwed, but the runs don't take very long so it's not a big deal. It's good at giving you new stuff to play with, there are a ton of wagons and weapons in the game you can unlock by completing the more difficult events. I've not actually beaten the game yet, it's pretty challanging to stay alive past all the stuff the game throws at you, but that's also why the game is fun. Don't expect Organ trail, it's really far from that sort fo game but still fun in it's own right (especially when it's relatively cheap).

28333981.review:
Der Titel sagt sehr viel, aber doch viel zu wenig aus. Das Spiel hat einen ganz eigenen Humor, der sich sowohl in den Texten vor jeder Szene, die man spielt, als auch in den Szenen selbst zeigt. 
Das Spiel enthält unter anderem auch minikleine Rollenspielelemente. Beispielsweiße kann man entscheiden, ob man der Ursache für die entfernten Schussgeräusche auf den Grund geht, oder ob man lieber weiter fährt. Oder ob man über den Fluss springen, oder durch ihn hindurchwaten möchte. Und und und. Jeder Weg birgt Möglichkeiten und Gefahren.

Man kann im Spiel sehr viele Waffen finden (von der Schrotflinte bis zum Düsenjet...) um damit die verschiedensten Arten von Gegnern zu bekämpfen. Hier möchte ich keine Beispiele nennen, denn damit wäre der WTF-Effekt ein wenig geschmälert. :D Es sei aber gesagt, dass man nicht nur gegen Banditen kämpft. Zwischendurch gibt es Passagen, in denen man Tiere jagen kann und deren Felle sammeln, um sie (eventuell) bei einem Händler gegen Leben, Waffen und...anderes zu tauschen. Freischalten kann man neben verschiedenen Spielmodi auch noch viele Wägen, die wiederum verschiedene Fähigkeiten haben.

Für 2,50€ (Im Sale bestimmt sogar billiger) bekommt man hier ein wirklich witziges, kleines Arcade-Game mit Wiederspielwert. Denn: Jeder Durchlauf ist anders! Die Geschichte der drei Abenteuerer wird in Tagen erzählt. Und bei jedem Neustart passiert an den einzelnen Tagen etwas anderes. Sollte man es also tatsächlich schaffen, den Adventure-Mode beim ersten Durchlauf zu meistern (was ich stark bezweifle), so lohnt es sich auf jeden Fall das ganze noch ein paar mal zu spielen - mit anderen Wägen und neuen Wegen. ;)

Von mir gibt's eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

(Btw. Ich hab mir die 2,50€ durch das Verkaufen der Sammelkarten erspart.^_^ Hab es also im Prinzip für lau bekommen.)

Bullet hell, Wild West simulator a la Oregon Trail... if you removed any reverance for the hardship of the frontier and included unrealistic, exaggerated craziness.
10/10 for the price.

5/5 Graphics
5/5 Music
4/5 Replayability
5/5 Game for the price

SAWA represents, to me, the ideal cheap game. It's inexpensive, it's a game you can pick up and play for 10 minutes, but it has plenty of unlockables, divergent events, and so on.

Basically each 'level' is dodging enemies or projectiles.  There are also plenty of bosses and minibosses, and each time you play is different.  What makes SAWA different is that the each event is insane, from accidentally jumping into outer space, to taking shrooms and fighting off your inner demons, or my personal favorite, fighting glitches in the game as they attack and try to break the game. 

There's not much to say, the replayability is great but does run dry and is completely randomized, so there's no way of knowing if you'll ever unlock some of them.  It's cheap, small, and a great time waster for a few laughs.

26141816.review:
I saw this game on sale for less than a buck and said "hey, why not?"  That was probably the best decision I made that day because I am getting way more than my money's worth out of it and I can say without a doubt that it is worth more than its full price.  Granted, this is not some Earth-shattering monument of technical achievement or anything.  But for what it is, it is very fun and will provide you with hours of amusement.  For an idea of what the game itself is like, imagine Oregon Trail meets Galaga as written by Tim & Eric and directed by Mel Brooks (because that totally doesn't sound like some kind of monster).  The gameplay itself is smooth, fun, and well-varied.  Most of the things that you come across are pretty much random events (there is some overall structure; i.e. you generally pass through most of the same 'zones' in the same order, however what those 'zones' contain tends to be randomized), and there are some very interesting (and amusing) random events.  Controls are simple and responsive and it's controller-compatible, so you've got options there.  There are also a bunch of unlockables to keep you engaged for a while, including different modes of play (sadly, however, no multiplayer).

Overall, this game is a really great deal if you like retro-styled side-scrolling shooter games with a heavy helping of humor.  Get it.  Play it.  Enjoy it.

25335197.review:
What I played: Super Amazing Wagon Adventure
What I expected: A super amazing wagon adventure
What I got: A sporadic impossible wagon adventure

This game is a lot harder than I had anticipated; your hitbox is the entire wagon, making it tricky to avoid incoming things. You can only fire directly in front of you, making it sometimes difficult to shoot incoming enemies that clip the edges of your wagon.

The controls were a bit hard to get used to at first; you move with WASD and press the spacebar (or mouse button) to shoot, but in scenes where you're walking around outside the wagon, the game plays like a top-down shooter like The Binding of Isaac, Hotline Miami, Nuclear Throne, etc. in that you move with WASD and shoot with the four directional arrow keys (or use the mouse cursor for more versatile accuracy). Of course, all these controls can be remapped as you desire, and even comes with gamepad support if you want to use a controller. 

Overall, this game refuses to take itself seriously, so why should you? This game is understandingly hard and it's easy to get frustrated, but given the nature of the game and how it's executed, I can't help but laugh every time I inevitably lose.

23698952.review:
Super Amazing Wagon Adventure
------------------------------------------------
Is like if you took the Oregon Trail and put it on an Atari Cartridge. Although the Graphics look slightly closer to that of intellivision.

First thing I hear is the music, while it is a loop, its is pretty cool and works well.

I absolutely love that there is choices for the family and that you can customize your own, and that There will be a huge selection of wagons avaiable even if you just start with 1.

The Brutal slaughtering of innocent animals all of the screen was pretty funny, while you did kill animals in the original Oregon trail it never looked as cool or funny as this is. 

Holy Fuckballs, Did I just get a rocketlauncher? Its coming right for us!

Some Bandits tried to roll up on me, but I shot them right in their stupid faces.

Then this crazy ass Machine gun Bandit comes out of nowhere and starts going rambo on me, god damn, No rest for the wicked.

After I blew that guy to kingdom come, I went off to find Berrys in the forest, That went pretty smoothly, tho I still fired some shots off for the fun of it.

I then found a cave and went to investigate, because why not going into A Dark Scary cave at random sounds like a great idea doesn't it?

So It was darker then 9/11 jokes in that cave, When I finally reached my lighter I saw the cave was filled with bats the size of cars, they swarmed and instantly ate me....My family went on without me.

They had to Cross a River My daughter told mom to jump it, but mom Decided to ford it, and then all these damn boulders came out of nowhere, followed by more boulders jesus! Stupid Boulders!

My Wife got Gangrene, and Damn she looked horrible.

Then came the Buffalo stampede, it left my wife dead.

It was upto my daughter to make it the gold rush and live on our family name....

Unfortunently A minute later she was gored by Bison.

GAME OVER.

Final Thoughts:
This was immensly fun, and very much like the Oregon Trail only funner and funnier. I Want to write you a longer review but I just want to get back on the trail already, my biggest complaint is no achievements and no trading cards. Other than that this is a fun little gem that will make you laugh, especially if your remember playing Oregon Trail.

Pros:
+Decent Controls even if they are basic, PLUS Controller support
+Decent Music
+Hillarious
+FUN AND FUNNY
+Educational
+Watch your Family Die 

Cons:
-No Trading Cards (Please Add!!!!)
-No Achievements (Please Add!!!!)
-Educational
-Watch your Family Die

Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a game that is a parody on old-timey educational computer games like the Oregon Trail.

RNG will heavily influence success and failure, but you'll be too busy laughing to be too mad.
Very fun.

22945520.review:
Frustrating, but not in a good way. 

I'm a fan of roguelite games; Binding of Isaac and Enter the Gungeon are two of my favourites, so I have no problems with a game that's tough as long as it's fair. Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is *not* fair though, so prepare to die. A lot. When there's more or less nothing you could do about it.

Your hitbox is the entire wagon (large), but the area your default weapon can attack is one small line right ahead of you. You will get hit many, many times by enemies just above or just below this area charging toward you. Anyone who makes it to the Buffalo will know what I mean. There are other weapons, but there's no way to store or change them, so if you get something that could help you later you can prepare to fire it off about two minutes before you really need it. 

Your wagon has three passengers, among whom damage is "shared". Hits land not-really-randomly on your party members, often hitting and killing one person before the other two. It's possible to get hitpoints back but this happens on a purely random basis, and consists of either events that may or may not happen or medkit pickups you may not be able to reach. The frustration that comes when you find a rare event only to realize it's your 1-HP guy instead of your 4-HP guy that you have to try to finish it with... agonizing.

There's some laughs to be had here; I thought it was hilarious when I had the option to either ford a river or jump over it, and then later either go around or swim under the river. There's also a ton of content and different paths your adventure might take; I was still finding new ones until I finally quit playing. 

It's a shame I'm not going to see the end of the game though because I cannot put up with these deaths that I have no real control over. If the hitbox on the wagon was a lot smaller and my gun could aim a little I'd probably play the hell out of this game. Sadly, I'm sick of it and going to see if I can get a refund.

22777847.review:
A parody of The Oregon Trail edutainment games.

Graphics are intentionally retro 8bit, with a CRT monitor filter you can optionally enable. Simplistic, low-detail sprites represent your wagon, your party and anything else that may or may not want to kill you - and the former grossly outnumber the latter.

Equally retro are the sound effects, with beeps and blops and a catchy MIDI-ish soundtrack.

Gameplay is like a sillier Oregon Trail - normally you control your wagon along a linear course, avoiding obstacles and shooting at things that (rarely don't) want to kill you. Your party has individual life bars and you lose once all of them are dead or missing. Events pop up after every gameplay section, ranging from shooting train robbers, to choosing between fording or jumping a river, to some rather spoiler-y occurences.

There's the main campaign mode, and progressing through it and beating certain challenges can unlock survival modes (last as long as possible in a gauntlet of enemies), shuffle modes (your starting settings are randomized from what I understand) and new wagons (which change your speed, party's health and firepower).

It's a small game and gets you a few laughs when you play short sessions of it, and it's probably in your best of interests not to take it too seriously, even if it does get a tad dark and difficult (especially difficult).

BUT NO, THROUGH ACTUALLY BEING MYSELF WITH THE MIC AND TEXT IN THIS GAME, I'VE ACTUALLY MADE FRIENDS AND I'VE EVEN MET FEMALES WHILE PLAYING THIS GAME!!!!

THIS GAME HAS HELPED ME OVERCOME MY CRIPPLING SOCIAL ANXIETY, JUST A BIT. IT GAVE ME A SHRED, JUST A SHRED OF AGENCY. I CAN COMMAND MY TEAM TO GO DEEP INTO ENEMY LINES; I CAN BE A LEADER! A LEADER, SOMETHING I AM RARELY EVER IN MY LIFE. IT GAVE ME THE CONFIDENCE TO SPEAK ON THE MIC WITH ACTUAL HUMAN BEINGS, AND SOMETIMES HAVE CONVERSATIONS! 

THE INTERACTIONS IN THE GAME ARE SOMETIMES PRICELESS, FOR EXAMPLE. I WAS PLAYING ALONE, 3A.M. AND I WAS PLAYING MEEPO, ALL THE LIGHTS OFF, COMFY SHIT. THERE WAS THIS ONE MAN ON MY TEAM, HE WASN'T FROM THE AMERICAS, BUT HE SPOKE ENGLISH. AND, JUST THE WAY THAT SOME PEOPLE TALK IN THIS GAME IS JUST, FUCKING CUTE. I LOVE IT. ANOTHER TIME, I WAS PLAYING ALONE AROUND THIS TIME AGAIN, AND MY TEAM WAS ALL COMMUNICATING AND SHIT, AND THIS GUY JUST SAID: "ROGER THAT" I DON'T KNOW WHY, BUT IT JUST FELT NICE. IT FELT LIKE WE WERE ALL WORKING TOGETHER. LIKE, WE WERE ALL WORKING SERIOUSLY, AND AS A TEAM. 

LOTS OF PEOPLE SAY THAT THEIR TEAMS ARE THE THING THAT ARE THE PROBLEM WITH THIS VIDEO GAME. BUT, FROM MY EXPERIENCES, IN SOME GAMES. YOU HAVE A PERFECT TEAM, AND YOU ALL WORK IN UNISON, IT JUST FELT GREAT. AND REMEMBER, THIS WAS IN SOLO, FUCKING, QUEUE. PLAYING WITH MY FRIENDS AND DOING ALL OF THIS, AND WORKING TOGETHER, COMPLETE FOCUS ON SOMETHING IS JUST FUCKIN' GREAT. IT'S GREAT.

DOIGN STUPID, GAY COMBOS WITH YOUR MATES IS GREAT TOO, OR DOING SOMEHTING FUCKING RETARDED, AND HAVING IT WORK IS BEAUTIFUL.

THIS GAME, TO ME IS A STEP TO BECOMING A FUNCTIONAL MEMBER OF SOCIETY. BUT, I FEEL THAT IT IS ALSO A WASTE OF FUKKING TIME. 4,300 FUCKING HOURS TO MANAGE TO LEARN A BIT OF AGENCY AND BASIC FUCKING CONVERSATION SKILLS IS NOT WORTH IT. I COULD HAVE TAKEN A CLASS FOR FUCKING LOSERS LIKE ME AND LEARNED TO HAVE MADE HUMAN RELATIONSHIPS WITH HUMANS!

21528622.review:
Эта игра одновременно прекрасно реализует игровой процесс Атари (я не застала её эру, но почерпнула многое о её очаровании из ретро-обзоров) и использует современные наработки. Например: Атари имела в распоряжении всего одну ручку и одну кнопку, а эта игра, когда требуется, использует две ручки. Это позволяет стрелять, пятясь, что ничуть не нарушает ретро-стиль - игровое поле всё равно представляет причудливую проекцию с условными действующими лицами, которые могут только двигаться и стрелять.

Кроме того, игра очень большая. Она состоит из последовательных сегментов, каждый из которых выбирается случайно из некоторого набора. Например, в большей части случаев в начале нападают бандиты, но вместо этого может появиться единорог. В конце перестрелки с бандитами обычно прибывает босс, но вместо этого они могут "наконец-то научиться целиться", и перестрелка застрекочет с новой силой. В игре много юмора и сатиры над идеализацией Дикого Запада.

Даже имитация кинескопа сделана прекрасно! Чего я не могу сказать о большей части игр, которые пытаются это провернуть - когда хочется выключить эффект и забыть о нём как о страшном сне. Здесь же без кинескопного искажения игра теряет зрелищности, и хочется поскорее вернуть настройку.

В общем, очень приятно, когда игра именно такая, какой она привлекает по скриншотам, описанию и видео.

20551128.review:
tldr:
Very arcadey with extremely simplistic gameplay.  Great sense of humor, but the lack of any truly addictive qualities makes this game very easy to put down.  There is nothing wrong with it, really.  There is just not much terribly right with it.  Very neat little game, good for at least a few minutes of entertainment if arcadey is not your thing.

extended:
This is more or less a series of extremely simple minigames strung together seemingly at random.  Most can be summarized as such: clumsily move around on the screen while dodging pixelated blobs and clicking to fire slow-moving bullets at such.  It can be amusing to see some of the situations described or depicted in the game, but the gameplay itself is lacking.  The controls are just clumsy enough that you never get into that addictive, edge-of-your-seat frenzy that the best arcade games can inspire.  Still, they are not so bad as to incite you to throw your peripherals at the monitor, and there is something to be said for character.

If there were an option for, "Maybe" instead of a simple yes or no, I would choose it.  That's a rare thing for me, because I am usually pretty opinionated about the games I play.  To put it in perspective, if I had paid $5 for this game instead of $2 on sale, I would feel extremely ripped off.  But for what I paid, I can appreciate the value.  Given all of this, I will err on the side of being positive and recommend the game.

I like this feature as it adds an extra layer to the randomness of this game. My only complaint with this is that you can't disable same-gender couples. On one of my journeys one of my party members (He was a guy and my best friend IRL) fell in love with my character (Who was also a guy). Huh, this'll be a nice relaxing sidescroller I can wind down with between other games.

What the fuck was I thinking.

Not only is this game the most fucking frustrating game I have ever played, it is also one of the funniest thanks to its originality. Other reviews praise the game for the "Shuffle" mode which allows you to play a completely random generated journey. Shuffle mode is unlocked after the "short" Adventure Mode is completed...

ATM I have over 16* hours in this game and have yet to beat this story mode. Never in my life have my mechanical keyboard and G502 been put to better use than killing 10-Pixel-People (yes) on a quest across the United States of America. (You may think this game is cheap at $3, but the investment into necessary gaming peripherals just to play the game properly, puts the cost at well over $150.)

If you, like I was, are looking for a game to play between other games... think again. This will become the Game you take a break from, not the other way around. 

That said, the only reason you'll be taking a break is to calm down before you shatter your monitor in a rage fueled punch after you stand up and curse at the bison or bandits, once more falling victim to the endless predators of the great North America.

19251253.review:
[h1]Excellent jeu et concept ![/h1]

[i][u]Super Amazing Wagon Adventure[/u][/i] est un jeu vraiment pas banal, et sans dire qu'il est moche ou manque d'ambitions il est vrai que la page du store ne donne pas nécessairement envie de s'y essayer, mais pourtant détrompez vous on est ici en face d'un excellent titre ! 

Pour parler rapidement du jeu en lui même, il s'agit tout simplement d'un shooter au style volontairement rétro que se soit dans les graphismes ou les bruitages tout est fait pour ressembler à l'un de ses vieux jeux d'Atari, dans un sens c'est moche mais dans un autre c'est juste suffisamment minimaliste pour être plutôt sympa à regarder et à jouer. Mais alors qu'on serait tenté de dire " Encore un ?" il faut savoir qu'en réalité le jeu s'avère être très amusant à parcourir, bourré d'humour et possède un petit côté loufoque et addictif très sympa. C'est simple lorsque vous commencer à jouer à ce jeu vous ne savait pas quand vous allez arrêter tellement on s'amuse sur ce titre. 

Alors le jeu en soit est déjà amusant  mais la possibilité de "personnaliser" son aventure en créant les personnages de notre petite équipe en se basant sur des amis rend l'aventure encore plus drôle. Voir son meilleur pote mourir piétiner par un bison ou asphyxier par la terrible odeur de putois sauvage c'est totalement débile mais qu'est-ce que c'est marrant ! D'autant plus que les différents événements se succède de manière purement aléatoire donc au final chaque aventure que vous allez vivre est dans un sens unique. Parfois deux aventures seront similaire mais très souvent ce ne sera pas le cas, d'autant plus qu'il existe énormément de possibilités toutes plus surprenante que d'autres et mine de rien même après plus de 2H de jeu on découvre encore de nouvelles choses à faire.

Il n'en à pas l'air c'est vrai mais ce petit titre indépendant en a dans le ventre et se révèle être un excellent divertissement. Je vous recommande fortement de lui donner sa chance, surtout qu'il ne coûte pas chère.

17980175.review:
Two words: Love This! This game is definitely the most hysterical game I've ever played! It's a really great 2D side-scrolling, shooter spoof of Oregon Trail. Essentially, Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a series of fast-paced, wacky, and (mostly) random sequences.

There's three characters on the wagon that you can name and customize to a small degree. This is great if you decide to name and model them after people who are watching you play the game, as there's no telling what craziness will happen on their journey. The game is short, but it's challenging... something modern games are sorely lacking. However, the replayability is very high, because you will experience many different sequences each time you play the game. You can also unlock survival modes and several different wagons with unique perks.

sparsevector nailed every single thing that he wanted to accomplish with this game. It does an excellent job of harkening back to old computer and Atari 2600 games (love the Motion Blurring and CRT Monitor effects). Simple and addictive gameplay, which is also reminiscent of older games. Insanely catchy soundtrack too, which comes with the game for free. Check out the "Desert Theme (Rap Remix)" track after playing for a while, it's freakin' hilarious!

To sum things up:
10/10 (You gotta go tenouttaten!)
This is the best Indie game out there (my opinion, but I think a lot of people would agree).
Seriously. I can't give this game enough praise. Amazing job, sparsevector! You're one funny and talented dude.

17688199.review:
The short version is for 2.99 this game is an absolute steal.  I absolutely recommend this game 100%.

Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a game that made the YouTube rounds a while back and for very good reason.  It's one of those absurd hilarious games that just refuses to stop surprising you hour after hour.  It starts off as a pretty standard Oregon Trail inspired adventure as you customize your party, and pick a wagon.  Then after that first ten seconds I'm pretty sure the game takes a handful of shrooms and maybe coke right to the face and goes completely off the rails.  This game isn't trying to have a compelling narrative, it doesn't want to be IGN's game of the year, and it's not trying to tun the industry upside down with it's wicked angsty edginess.  No, SAWA is a game that just wants to be fun.  It wants to take you an adventure infused with pure randomness and heart of comedy gold.  You'll jump rivers and end up in space, you'll go looking for food and end up tripping balls, you'll be making your way across the plains and then fighting a Buffalo filled tornado.  A FREAKING BUFFANADO!

Visuals- The atari style graphics are simple yet endearing, and the color is perfect for the cartoony feel.  It's not winning any awards but it's perfect for the game.

Replayability- This game has it!  Not because this game offers new wagons and things to unlock, but because you just can't stop from wondering what could be next.

Sound-  Similar to the visuals, it's good but not mindblowing.  It's everything this game should be.

Gameplay_  The shooting can be a bit on the garbage side which is a shame.  You'll die a surprising amount, and what you die from will usually be even more surprising.  This game at points doesn't seem to follow any rules either.  I was once killed by a bear with no way to defend myself.  If this kind of thing bothers you, may be best to look else where.

16489924.review:
Short version: This game has unicorn ambushes, rabid squirrel attacks, and river jumping. You should buy it.

Slightly longer version: This game is merciless, unforgiving, and totally ruthless, just as an Oregon Trail homage should be. You are in a wagon and have a gun to shoot things. Sometimes you get out of the wagon to shoot things. If you are lucky you get medical recovery items and better guns, from shotguns to carpet-bombing airplanes. If you are not lucky, your three characters get horrible diseases and die to machine-gun-armed bandits and Civil War fights. More often than not, the latter will build up and have your journey end terribly.

What keeps the game from getting overly frustrating (at least for me) is the humor. This game is hilarious, and it has everything from dinosaurs to satellites. The narration is fantastic, and it is worth playing for that alone. It's why I got the game, despite usually not being a fan of these types of games. Super Amazing Wagon Adventure was just too funny to skip.

It controls well, once you get the hang of it. I personally am terrible with keyboards for games, but from how it felt, I'm fairly certain a keyboard-savvy player will usually be perfectly fine. There are plenty of options as well, ranging from a number of wagons you can unlock to survival modes. With the numerous scenarios your playable party can get into, it has high replayability.

This game is $3 for a base price, and the witty narration is worth that alone. Add in the other great factors, such as the unlockables and tight controls, and you have a huge winner. Now if you'll excuse me, I need to go back to dying to buffalo.

16409510.review:
For only a dollar or two, this is an excellent game that's as ridiculously difficult as it is funny. Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is basically a shoot 'em up / bullet hell type of game that starts very slowly and that adds more and more and more elements to the mix until you can't take it, putting you in situations where you must dodge rabid bears while shooting at bandits while steering your wagon through flaming tumbleweeds. The gameplay is very simple, but the developers really nailed the difficulty right, which forces you to constantly stay on your toes and expect the worst possible outcome. Random elements and choices leading to several possible outcomes ensure a different playthrough almost everytime you try to clear the game and there are several fun unlockables for completionists.

Come for the price tag, stay for the hilarity, and make sure all your friends get to try it as you watch.

16286037.review:
This is the kind of game that makes me question if I should continue to bother with video games or not. Am I just wasting my time? Are these games that've been hyped to heaven with almost no backlash just bald-faced lies spitting in my face? I have come to this point after wasting so much of my life, throwing myself over 20 hours closer to my death, playing this repetitive, poorly balanced, poorly made-in-general piece of fucking garbage. Yes, I despise this game. I have finally come to terms with that conclusion. I tried giving it one more chance after my first (also negative) review that's now deleted, unlocked a few more wagons and modes, but nothing changed for me except the growing hatred for this game, my grown distrust for popular consensus and for sources of game coverage I thought were reliable, and the weariness this has brought upon my life in general. I really, really hate this game.

OK to start: what it looks like: an absurdist, tongue-in-cheek parody of Oregon Trail (obviously), like the video game equivalent of a Mel Brooks or an old Zucker/Abrahams movie. And that description is accurate to some extent. This is a game full of zany, random occurrences, ridiculous humor, and gameplay that, to put it one way, bears little resemblance to the original Oregon Trail. This is all just window dressing though. Strip it aside and what you have instead is a really awful vertical shmup mixed in with awful twin-stick shooter segments with a factor of randomization added to try to give it variation but they bungled it up so badly that it makes already badly done mechanics more frustrating.

If there is a singular goal in this game, it's to unlock all the wagons, since doing so requires accomplishing pretty much every possible task in the game. One wagon requires you not only unlock all five levels in survival mode, but get three full stars in all of them (which means surviving three or more minutes), another requires unlocking "shuffle mode" where you must survive as many randomly ordered scenes from the main game in a row (to get the wagon you need to survive 50), and unlocking the final wagon means completing the main adventure with ALL the wagons. Most of the wagons are unlocked by stumbling upon and surviving random scenarios, some rarer than others, in the game. 

The main adventure allows you to ride a wagon with three attendants, which you can customize to some degree by gender, hair style, hair color, manner and color of dress, skin color, eyes, and facial hair (reserved for the men only). This is probably the most fun part of the game, not that it's necessarily interesting in itself, even if it is amusing, but because it's the one and only thing in this game that doesn't cause immense suffering. Then you pick your wagon which you only have one to start with and, if I'm being perfectly honest, is probably better than the majority of wagons I've tried so far. It sucks, but it sucks less so than some of the other crap you get. Now the concepts for the wagons sound fun but actually playing with them? No. The magic wagon has probably the worst default weapon of everything in the game, firing spread "magic" shots in wide angles, too wide actually, and disintegrates things when it kill them meaning you can't collect precious animal hides with it (better get a power-up!), and it fires slowly at that. The invisible wagon starts you off with 1 health for everyone, no joke, as a compromise for how small and easily maneuverable it is. If you survive the first areas and can grab full health for everyone it's great, otherwise, good luck. The space shuttle starts you all off with TWO health, has an even larger hit box than the other wagons (which are too big as it is, making the NES Silver Surfer's seem like a pixel by comparison), has only the same regular attack as the main wagon, and is faster, meaning, harder to control when you're faced by a barrage of enemies and herds of buffalo who will most assuredly kill you much faster. I could go on about how annoying and unfun some other wagons are but really it's the game itself that's out to get you more than the crappiness of your wagons (though that doesn't help).

OK like I said the game is randomized, but not to the extent a roguelike or even some roguelites would take it. It's more like a Tower of Guns roguelite where there is a small amount of randomization but with mostly clear-cut, set paths, level designs and so forth, the difference being that Tower of Guns was actually not a terrible game (I gave up on some of its frustrating challenges eventually but for the most part had a good time with it). The game begins the same way every single time - you kill animals for fur, run into some bandits, seek either wild berries (or if the game wants to fuck you over, shrooms, though surviving that once does unlock a wagon - but after that, it grows tiresome), then you come to a river crossing, where you can either jump or ford it. Most of the wagons are too slow, clunky and big to bother fording, so I always jumped (which sometimes landed me in the river anyway, getting me hit by boulders coming downriver). There is one set of boulders where you must wait for them to come down, with a space opening up to go through but I swear unless you have a fast-moving wagon this is literally impossible to get through without getting hit. And it goes on and on and on. The game itself is not that long, but you will be assuredly killed repeatedly due to the crappiness of the mechanics and the random events which will screw you over big time.

Sometimes the game asks if you want to investigate something, like distant gunfire (which is either a bank or train robbery), but a lot of times it forces you into situations that you don't want to go into. Like, no, I don't want to save the injured falcon or get the poison gun for the billionth time, especially if I'm at the brink of death and have a perfectly capable gun already at my disposal. But it will anyway and you have no choice but to go along with it. Some situations you may as well quit your game since you will get bent if you encounter them. Like having to travel to a distant trader for a new wheel with the falcon with coyotes all over you. These segments are long and the falcon really sucks at taking down large numbers of fast-moving enemies at once. Then you die and you must repeat the process with one of the other surviving characters and you die again. And if you're forced to meet a woman in a red dress and she turns into a bandit, just... quit right there. After that you will be assaulted by bandits you have no chance of winning against. Oh, and buffalo. I don't know how you're supposed to survive the large herds of buffalo with a large wagon without a decent weapon, and if your characters (idiotically) decide they're "bored" and speed through the herd, you're dead, and frankly they deserve it for being so goddamn stupid as to speed through buffalo to be trampled to death by them and your poorly handled vehicle. Oh yeah there are "twin stick" segments where you might be alone on foot and fight enemies without your wagon or compadres. Your hitbox is more reasonable, but movement never felt "right" nor did the mouse aiming. There are too many fast-moving, tiny enemies hard to hit with your puny weapons with you being too slow to outrun them and eventually you'll be circled and killed. That's actually more a complaint of the survival mode than of the main game but it can happen. 

But no matter where you die, whether by buffalo, by wolves on a mountain, or river boulders, the game always feels so inanely repetitive. You will encounter every scenario, of which there are very few, so many times trying to complete the game with one of your many crappy wagons and failing that it becomes a mentally numbing experience. I don't want to hunt more wildlife, bandits, berries, or choose to cross or ford rivers ever again. This is sheer endurance, not fun.

[b]Super Amazing Wagon Adventure[/b] ist ein schnelllebiges 2D-Shooting Spiel mit einer zufällig generierten Story. Der Spieler steuert eine Gruppe von drei Migranten, wie den Westen lang reisen in einem Wagon. Mit verschiedenen, zufällig aneinander gereihten Szenen, wird ein Semi-Zufälliges verrücktes Abenteuer erschaffen.

[h1]Grafik[/h1]
Die Grafik ist sehr minimalistisch gehalten. Ich persönlich mag eigentlich Pixel-Grafik sehr, doch kann ich hier nur ein Mittelmäßig da lassen. Man hätte mehr tun können. Im Großen und Ganzen ist die Grafik allerdings recht stimmig.

[h1]Musik & Sound[/h1]
Ich mag die Musik sehr. Sie ist stimmig und motiviert gut zu sein! Hierfür gibt es die volle Punktzahl. Auch der Sound ist einfach gehalten und insich passend.

Für den Preis hat sich der Kauf definitiv gelohnt. Ich emphele es jedem weiter, der Spaß daran hat, einiges freizuschalten und sich nicht über Tode ärgert.

Ingesammt würde ich dem Spiel 6,5 von 10 Punkten geben!

System Specs:

i3-4150, EVGA 750ti Superclocked ITX system. 
Resolution: 1920x1080
Average framerate: 100000000
Graphics settings: Atari 2600
Input device used: Xbox 360 Gamepad, Wii U Pro controller with Mayflower Adapter. 

Gameplay: Amazing, unpredictable, hilarious. Super fast-paced and quite difficult depending on what wagon type you're using. Characters die at random. Watch out for bear dens and spiders! It's like the oregon trail on crack and often feels like a bullethell. 

Story, Characters: The story and characters' names and likenesses change with every playthough. You're a caravan of settlers trying to settle. You can customize characters and input the names of your friends or enemies! 

Atmosphere, Graphics: Atari-like graphics with vivid colours.  I recommend you play in CRT mode for some pre-birth nostalgia!

Sound/Music:Fun chip-tune music. The best music is in the timed survival mode.

I'd like to add that this game gets very difficult and it definitely helps if you do not use the standard wagon, especially near the end levels. To be honest, I was never patient (or skilled) enough to finish it myself, but had tonnes of fun watching a friend get frustrated, but masterfully beat it. The weapon/cart upgrades and ever-changing story make every playthrough unique and fun-filled. 

8.0/10

15443544.review:
[b]Quick Breakdown:[/b] A side scrolling shooter with occasional top down segments. The game features buffalo, underwater buffalo, space buffalo, flying buffalo, flaming buffalo, and zombie buffalo. Also wagons.
[b]Length:[/b] 1-3 hours
[b]Score:[/b] 5.75/10

[b]Full Review:[/b] Super Amazing Wagon Adventure (from here on SAWA) is a 2D side scrolling shooter with pixel graphics. Occasionally throughout the gameplay things will switch to a top down view, allowing you to shoot in all directions. You play as a group of three travelers, each one has 4 HP; all riding together in a wagon (never did quite figure out how the game determines who’s HP to subtract from). The game features randomized scenarios to boot. For the most part, it’s pretty simple stuff.

But a review isn’t complete with just the quick summary, so let’s delve into it a bit more, shall we? Let’s begin with the game mechanics first. The bulk of the gameplay is the side scrolling shooting portion. From a gameplay perspective, it’s not anything spectacular, but it’s mildly fun. The screen scrolls automatically, and you can move up, down, back, and forth as it does; all the while shooting animals that you can pick up and use as food, or fending off attacking bandits. 

The top down portions let you walk about the screen and do much the same, you fend off attacking animals and bandits.

The game also features different guns for one to use, such as a flamethrower, a basic machine gun, and even the ability to summon a jet to carpet bomb the entire screen. Play-wise, it’s not the grandest thing out there, but it works alright.

The game is designed to have randomized scenarios, so as to mix up the game a bit. The game still follows the same basic progression each time, starting out in a forest, then encountering a river, then the plains, etc. But the individual scenarios that make up each of those vary, and some scenarios are more common than others. The game will sometimes even give you occasional binary options, for example allowing you to use your wagon to ford a river, or alternatively you can try jumping over the river. While this doesn’t mix up the gameplay too greatly, it does help add a bit more to it, especially during the first couple times playing.

The different scenarios are one of the things the game does better, as in addition to adding more variety, they also provide a small dose of humour. Granted, it’s of the “lol so random” variety, and while it’s cheap and juvenile, it’s still moderately enjoyable, and I did chuckle at a few of them. Such as the time I tried to jump over a river and a gust of wind sucked me into outer space, where I was attacked by buffalo. Or when the volcano erupted and rained hellfire upon my trusty wagon while flaming wolves assaulted me from the stream of lava that was chasing me. And the time when the tornado sucked me up and threw even more buffalo towards my party. (The game has a lot of buffalo).

As you play through the game you’ll be able to unlock different wagons by completing certain events in game. Follow a unicorn and defend yourself from its horde of brethren before slaying a dragon and you get a fantasy style carriage. Discover prehistoric dinosaurs and you can ride upon a triceratops, and throw dinosaur eggs that explode with baby pterodactyls that home in on enemies.

The game itself isn’t very long, and a successful run through will only take about 10-15 minutes, but you’ll die a few times along the way. Chances are it’ll take you between 1-3 hours to finish your wagon adventure.

The difficulty in the game is a bit wonky, as while the gameplay itself isn’t too terribly difficult, it can be a bit cheap sometimes with how the RNG gods decide to treat you. You may, for instance, suddenly contract the measles, dropping your health down to 1 HP for a single character, or to suddenly being blessed with an additional party member to join your wagon (effectively another set of hit points). Point being that a lot of the difficulty comes down to random events that are beyond your control, and sometimes are the make or break for successfully finishing the game. That’s a rather poor way to handle difficulty, and it’s a strike against the game.

In addition to the main game, there are also a couple different survival modes that let you see how long you can last against different hordes of wild animals, aiming of course for the best score possible.

Completing the game will unlock a shuffle mode, which throws random scenarios at you from the game, which you play until your entire party dies. Your score is how many scenarios you can complete before something claims your life.

The game’s graphics are done in a retro pixel art style, and really aren’t anything special. They aren’t great looking retro style throwback, in the vein of a game like [i]Shovel Knight[/i] or [i]Hotline Miami[/i]. They’re bare bones, and they’re really just there. Which I guess is okay for what the game is, but they’re nothing to get excited about. Likewise, the music for the game isn’t very notable either.

In the end, it’s by no means a must have game, but it’s only $3, and it sometimes goes on sale for even less than that. So while even at that price point it’s not a must have, it can be a fun way to kill some time if you’re in the mood for this sort of thing.

This is my first ever Steam Review and one that I should have done a long, long, LONG time ago (apologies to Sparsevector :P).

The game still surprises me to even this day with new stuff that I've never seen.  I don't want to make it sound like a fact, but you will be hard-pressed to find someone who's played this game longer than I have, so for me to say that it [b]still[/b] produces new scenes I've never experienced before, that's a stunning achievment.

I won't go into detail about the finer points of controls, branching story-arc, the "meta" game or anything like that.  All I will say is that I've enjoyed playing the game for many years now, and the ability to rename the travelers is an instant trip to hilarity every time someone new dies.  For less than the cost of a decent sandwich, I've enjoyed over 100+ hours and many years of entertainment from SAWA and it continues to be a staple of my routine.  

[b]I don't do numerical ratings, so take my review for what it is:  Two thumbs up. [/b]

14703902.review:
This is an extremely comical roguelike of sorts, fitting the bill of permadeath and random generation. In addition, it has an exquisite challange factor, whilst managing to not feel punishing (or at least, leaving you a hope you won't get that particular encounter in the foreseeable future). It features unlockable wagons and music that accents the games lighthearted and pleasant qualities. 
As for the actual gameplay itself, however, it is a horizontally scrolling shoot-'em-up, when in the wagon, which is of course most of the time. Who ever went to Oregon on foot, that's silly and extremely dangerous.
At first glance, it's simplistic, not much challenge in it. But the rapidity of your movement, the size of your hitbox, and the sheer number and speed of hostile entities makes this game, for better or for w̶o̶r̶s̶e̶  better, a Bullet Curtain. Overall, highly recommended for its quick pace, delightful humour (and the utterly bizarre twists and turns that entails), and of course, its refreshing Roguelike and Shoot-'Em-Up elements. Enjoy! I got my three dollars' worth in a lunchbreak.

14333917.review:
[h1][b]"It's like a cheap deep-fried food you usually find on the street food corner. Not too filling and kind of unhealthy, but it's cheap and you can eat it while on the way."[/b][/h1]









Super Amazing Wagon Adventure created by sparsevector back in 2013. In this game, you play as 3 migrants travelling west....And that's where the similarities end. To put it simple, this game is a retro-like side-scroll shooter with randomness and humor that's all around the place. Expect wacky situations to occured when travelling west. 
- Civil war? Check.
- Bank robery? Check.
- Zombies? Check.
- Battling inner demon? Check.
- And many more
Even your migrant's death descriptions are funny. Well, in most cases. 
One playthrough usually last about approximately 10 minutes (maybe more, maybe less). While some argue that the short duration of each gameplay can hurt the replay value, that's not really the case in the game. There are variety of wagons that can be unlockable during the main story, and because of the randomness, you can't really unlock them during one gameplay. And the way to unlock the said wagon also worthwhile. 

What else I could say about the game?
- Controls are responsive
- The sound assets are catchy, and kinda fit with the whole wacky nature of the game. 
- The system requirements are low

Probably the only thing I dislike about the game are the screen transitions. It's kinda fast sometimes, I can't finish reading the text. Because of the wackiness, I don't really recommend this to people that hate randomness in their games. But if you like unpredictable situations, do get this game. It's cheap, fun, and can be done in a short time, something rare these days (IMO). 

TL;DR: A quick game that you can play when taking a short break from your activity, and also fun.

Also, one last word. [b]Buffalo[/b]

13892096.review:
Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a side scrolling shooter. It's very clearly based on games from the 80s. You have to get your wagon from point A to point B... and shot things along the way. There are cool powerups, interesting little random events that may help or harm your run, traders to buy things from, and multiple forks in the road to keep the game fresh and replayable. There are also different unlockable wagons to use, each with their own advantages, disadvantages, and special quirks. There's not a whole lot more to say about the gameplay. It's mostly just automatically scrolling to the right as you move around the screen and shoot. It can be pretty easy or very hard depending on your choices and your luck. It's rather short, but highly replayable. I love the art style and the soundtrack is also pretty freakin' catchy. Plus the appropriate sound effects, of course. I really wish I could write a longer, more detailed review, but that's all there really is about it. It's fun, addictive, and only costs 3 bucks at full price. If you enjoy games you can complete in a sitting, this is great. And it keeps you coming back for more with the random events and different wagons. The only downside for this game is that... I wish there was more. More stuff in it. A longer trail. More events. Just... more everything. But I can't fault the game for any of that because what it DOES have is all great and makes for a wonderful experience that not many games aim to give you anymore. If you're thinking about it, just get it. You might not sink hundreds of hours into it, but the ones you DO put into it will all be worthwhile playtime, no filler.

Super Amazing Wagon Adventure gets an 8/10 for being a very fun little experience with lots of replayability and that throwback feeling.

13603349.review:
Oddly replayable.  Super Amazing Wagon Adventure plays like a NES game.   It's simple pixel graphics are completely justified with nice effects and an actual attempt to care.  For instance,  blood splatters, look like pixel blood splatters.    Visually, the style works.

The sound is amazing too,  and I regret not bein able to find a soundtrack.

What you're looking at is essential a Rogue Like.   A very fast paced one at that that is completely and utterly unforgiving.  Master the controls,  and get a rythem down for the random events allows you to survive.  So not only do you need technical skill playing, but also the fate of an RNG.   

Lots of unlockables also means that while you don't get to the end each time,  you might at least pull out a new Wagon,  or discover a differnt event.    

Finally, price.  You just can't beat it.  Worthwhile overall,   

Are there negatives?  Not really,  apart from sometimes getting creamed too often by the random generator,   slightly off putting.   Fixable?  Sorta, but that's not the point.

13207236.review:
A fun, quick fix of quirky arcade shoot'em. Good humor, enough difficulty and random happenings to make replays fun and interesting. The story gets pretty intense sometimes, i.e. the wagon ending up in space or submarining its way across a deep river. There are unlockable special wagons with special guns and abilities. 
The single best part, however, is definitely the death descriptions. Particularly funny because you can name your characters, the descriptions of their death are the icing on the cake. For each way they die, and in each different environment, the descriptions are unique and deliviered in such a deadpan way that you can't help but chuckle when your entire party has just been decimated by flying buffalo in a tornado, even though your entire party was decimated by buffalo in a tornado.

12600515.review:
It was a dangerous journey, they knew that. But HornyFishMan, NuggleSnugg, and HurgaDerga had to do it. It was time they traveled to the West Coast in their trusty station wagon. Leading the group, HornyFishMan picks up his uzi. They hunt. Bandits attack. Some could even aim. They reach a river. They ford it. Boulders... so many boulders... and then the pirate ship attacked. Luckily, there was a rocket launcher in the river. A few quick shots, and it's down. Suck it, Blackbeard.

The group enters the Great Plains. Buffalo buffalo buffalo. The number of buffalo was absurd. HurgaDerga is impaled by a buffalo, and I swear he will be missed. NuggleSnugg and HornyFishMan go on. Horny is healed by health kits that was bought, along with a flame thrower, with the buffalo hide. Remember, the ones that killed HurgaDerga? Revenge is sweet. They see a woman in a red dress. HornyFishMan stops to see if she needs help. It wasn't a trap, and she needs no help. She thanks Horny and sends him away. A civil war battle is underway nearby. The group says hello. There were no survivors. 

The group reaches another river. It was time the station wagon went underwater. Water buffalo water buffalo water buffalo. The group reaches an island. Horny notices supplies on the shore. He takes them. It was a trap! PELICANS! Luckily, he survives. They swim to shore.

They reach a mountain pass. Food supplies were running low, so they hunted. No bandits this time, but wolves. So many wolves. They find a trader. They use the wolves they murdered to buy a double-barreled uzi. There is a snow storm, yet the wolves continue to attack. Bastards... They deal with the wolves, and see a strange figure in the distance... Horny investigates.

BIGFOOT! Horny runs at him, and having found another flamethrower in the snow, takes him down easily. It is now out of ammo, though, so he gets his double-barreled uzi back out. Infinite ammo rocks! He runs back to the wagon, and the snow storm was rough, so in their panic, they drive off a cliff.

Buffalo followed HornyFishMan and NuggleSnugg off the cliff. So many buffalo. They dodge all the buffalo, and manage to land safely in a river. Having lost their wheels, the station wagon became a raft. They navigated through boulders and fought off alligators. Then they reached a bandit ambush. The bandits attacked with shotguns on their rafts. Successfully defending themselves from the bandits, alligators, and boulders, the group could see the West coast. They almost made it! But then a bandit showed up. He had found some sort of steam boat. Lighting up the boat as much as possible, it wasn't enough. A bandit holding a shotgun on top of the steam boat fired, and Horny wasn't quick to the dodge. NuggleSnugg joined Hurga, after all this time. She came so far, and it didn't even matter. Horny, in all his rage, blew up the boat with his uzi, ending his bandit problem. Reaching shore, Horny shoots pelicans in celebration. He made it to the West coast, though he lost his best friends. He will never forget that fateful Super Amazing Wagon Adventure.

12442364.review:
This game has made me laugh out loud more than any game I can remember.

The only problem with it is that it may be TOO historically accurate.

*

It's a thinly veiled side-scrolling SHMUP that milks just about every kind of variant gameplay possible from the genre, and has the political correctness of Oliver Stone directing Monty Python on a cocaine rush. If you grew up in the 80s/90s, this entire game might be seen as either revenge for or praise of your Atari 2600, the Oregon Trail, and that one infamous Battletoads stage.

You will cause the genocide of buffalo and, potentially, unicorns. It's utterly, stupidly brilliant. Buy it.

12410949.review:
Nettes Indiespiel, welches man trotz kleinem Umfang für kurze Runden spielen kann.
In diesem Spiel geht es um 3 Leute, die mit ihrem Wagon durch zufällig ausgewählten
Gebieten  fahren. Dabei kann es passieren, das ihr im ersten Moment durch einem
Wald fahrt, und im 2. Banditen vor euch aufkreuzen, die ihr erstmal besiegen müsst.

In dem Spiel gibt es 2. Steuerungsschemas.
Einmal die, wo ihr im Wagon durch die Gegend fahrt,
und die, wo ihr euch ganz normal bewegen könnt.
Beim Wagon fahren fahr ihr (außer bei einem bestimmten Ereigniss) nur nach rechts.
Bei dem Spieler wiederrum könnt ihr euch in einem kleinen Gebiet frei bewegen.

Außerdem gibt es Waffen und weitere Items, die man aufsammeln kann.
Zusätzlich zu dem ganzen noch viele Wagons, die alle eine bestimmte Fähigkeit besitzen.
Diese muss man aber erst freischalten.

Neben den normalen Gegnern gibt es dann auch noch starke Bosse, aber ich will ja nicht zuviel verraten. ;)
Das würde ja den ganzen Spaß nehmen. ^^

Eine gute Idee? Ja, definitiv. Und sie macht sogar Spaß.
Für wirklich kleines Geld bekommt ihr hier echt ein wirklich tolles Spiel,
was für kurze Runden wirklich sehr viel Spaß bereitet.

Für alle, die Indiegames mögen, ist dies eine KLARE Kaufempfehlung und sollte in keiner Indiespiele-Bibliothek fehlen.

12068538.review:
This game is as addicting as it is hard. 9 times out of 10 I die on an adventure, but the idea of the possiblity of triggering a rare event is what makes you keep coming back to it. And it's not the kind of game that you have to warm up to either; I can just pick it up, play through an adventure, and leave if need be.

Personally, I like unlocking things. Even if I don't put it to frequent use, unlockables are very similar to accomplishments for me, so naturally I never get tired of SAWA. The numerous unlockables aren't just for keeping you engrossed in the game; they make you go for certain events that you may not have chosen otherwise (I'm talking about the rivers here). I personally don't like going into the desert with the snakes, scorpians, and vultures, but when I saw the locked Survival mode, I figured I'd go to try and unlock it. Because of this, I encountered new events that I never would've seen without the motivation to go back to that desert. Now I like alternating between different areas to see what kind of new or unlikely events I can trigger!

This isn't intended to be a hardcore game, but there are those kind of challenges for the people that always aim for the gold in video games. You know what kind of challenges I mean, and SAWA has them, namely the Random wagon, where you have to make it 50 days in Shuffle without dying. For those who haven't played Shuffle mode, it's a hard challenge. Take it from me.

SAWA is great for gamers of all types: casual, hardcore, completionists, you name it. I definitely recommend this game, even if it's for an hour.

11977320.review:
３人のプレイヤー（名前や姿はランダムもしくは自分で設定可能）が馬車に乗って何が起こるかわからない奇想天外？の旅をするというレトロ風味の横スクロールシューティングゲーム。
（ちなみにライフ制でコンティニューやセーブの類は一切無し。）

このゲームの特徴はなんといってもただの横シューかと思いきや10数秒ごとにランダムで起こるさまざまな出来事だろう、、

例えば横シューモードで鹿（？）やリス（？）を狩って食料集めをするかと思いきやいきなり馬に乗ったガンマンらしき人物が襲ってきてソレを撃退して一安心したら（ちなみに乗っていた馬も一応食料になる。）突然ゾンビの大群に襲われいきなり全方向シューティングになったり、バッファロー（食料）が凄まじい群れをなして襲ってきたり、さらに川を下ったかと思いきや竜巻に巻き込まれ、竜巻の中でこれまたバッファローの群れに襲われる、、
（ちなみに中には選択肢があるイベントもあり、選択によってゲームオーバーになることも、、）

また道中にはライフ回復アイテムや様々な武器アイテム（弾数制）があり、武器によっては正確に射撃できない武器や爆撃機を呼んでが絨毯爆撃を行うというとんでもないものがあったり、あまりにも威力がありすぎて食料となる動物が砕け散ってしまい食料として回収できないものなど種類は意外に多い。
（アイテムは道中に落ちているもを収得するほかにランダムで出てくるトレーダーから食料と交換で入手できたりする。）

そんな感じで（アドベンチャーモードの場合）ゲーム内時間で約100-200日前後（ランダムで多少の増減あり）の冒険をするのだが、冒険中に起こるランダムイベントが妙に馬鹿馬鹿しいものが結構あり個人的に面白く遊べた。
（アドベンチャーモードを本当にクリアしたかどうかは馬車選択画面で確認可能。（クリアした馬車はチェックマークがつく。））

１回のプレイは約10-20分前後で冒険の過程でさまざまなゲームモードや乗れる馬車（それぞれ能力が違う。中には馬車と呼べないものもあるのはご愛嬌。）が追加されたりとやりこみもそこそこあり。

操作のほうもキーボード＋マウスとXInput形式（XBox360コントローラーやロジクールコントローラーなど）のコントローラに対応しており、操作形態もシンプルで良好。
（ただ、ランダムイベントによってはプレイヤーが泥酔しているという理由でまともに操作できないことがあるがそれはご愛嬌ということで、、）

古臭いゲームが嫌いな人や過剰なランダム要素が嫌いな人はお勧めはしないが、価格も安いので、馬鹿馬鹿しいゲームで時間を潰したい方はどうぞ、、

11506924.review:
Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a randomly generated sidescrolling shooter that banks on a couple things: goofiness, nostalgia (slightly) and not caring too much about shooter games.

If I was to judge it purely based on its mechanics, it's not much more than mediocre. The weapon options are nothing too special, and the enemies mainly rely on strength of numbers to add challenge. The boss fights that I've experienced so far were OK but no big deal.

What really is entertaining is the silly nature of the entire endeavor. The game takes a lot of cues from Oregon Trail and basically makes fun of every option.

"There is a river. [Tom] has the brilliant idea to jump over it. Or, you could try fording it."
[Ford]
[Jump]

And then you can actually jump over the river if you want to.

Other times you might be attacked by modern cars or "inner demons", and the text that accompanies almost every event is weird and goofy. And it works almost every time, and because the game is so quick to play (the game I won probably took between 5-10 minutes) and there are a lot of options, it hasn't yet gotten old.

But it probably will eventually. And when I'm tired of seeing a million buffalo charge at me for the hundredth time, then I'll probably stop because all it has left are the mechanics, which, as stated, really aren't much special.

Still, it doesn't cost much, and it still plays much better than the far more tedious McPixel (I don't know why I feel the comparison is necessary - highly pixelated graphics and bite-size gameplay I guess, but nothing else much is in common so *shrug*) and I still foresee getting some quality time out of it, so I would recommend it!

11087228.review:
Take the famous Oregon Trail, discard most of the historical facts and add a lot of random nonsense and you get Super Amazing Wagon Adventure!

Cruise through forests, fields, deserts and even underwater in your trusty wagon and try to stay alive!
And staying alive isn't so easy with almost everything out to get you! Bandits, wild animals, zombies and mother nature are trying to stop you from reaching your goal.
So what do you do? Offense is the best defense, right? So just shoot everything!
Your starting wagon gives you only a weak pistol, but you might find a lot of other weapons on your way, including shotguns, flamethrowers, bazookas and even an airstrike!
Unlock more wagons with better starting weapons, including the Diseased, which spreads disease! Or how about the Glitch, which shoots...stuff!

Most of the time the game is a sidescrolling shooter. You man your wagon and fire away, but once in a while you'll have to leave your wagon and fight on foot and it's fun all the way.
It might be a bit unfair from time to time, depending on what scenes you end up in, but the game is rather short anyway, so just try again! A great game for in between!
It's also really cheap and if you're into sillyness, this game is worth a consideration!

I bought this game during the Steam Summer sale for a dollar and some change. I've heard very good things about this game and honestly, it's all it lives up to be and then some. At first, the game plays out pretty well and there's a few good moments that's genuinely comedic but after playing more than 30 minutes of the game, you begin to actually take the game seriously and find that some parts are unforgiving if not seemingly impossible.
I've currently unlocked about 6-8 of the wagons so far but not each without their own pain of doing so. The game becomes reptitive after a while and some of the challenges more frustrating than funny. I can't tell you how many times I've threw out a f-bomb when dying by ninjas in an event I cannot control or trying to navigate a maze with falling boulders and ravenous wolves or running down a river with boulders that you cannot navigate through (or destroy because a lack of a good gun). 
Over all, the game is enjoyable and something you can sit back and play for 15 minutes at a time but if you plan to play more of it, prepare for a kick in the balls because this game is quickly unforgiving.

10987874.review:
This is the perfect game for a five minute break.
I bought Super Amazing Wagon Adventure on a whim when it was 90 cents on Summer Sale. I figured it looked cheap, but might be fun, and 90 cents I could spare.
I was surprised - positively.
Super Amazing Wagon Adventure honors its (obviously sarcastic) name by bringing just the right amount of cynic, over-the-top humoristic gameplay served with a side of nostalgia. It's really hard at some points, but that just makes sure it doesn't become a repetitive boring click fest. It's fast, fun and ferociously insane and made me laugh many times - or how often have you been dodging a rain of buffalo while falling off a cliff with your space-shuttle-pulled-by-mule wagon, gripping onto your laser cannon for dear life, all in 1840?
That's what I thought.
Get this game, even if only to support small developers with wacky ideas, or you might just lose three hearts to space dysentery.

10984474.review:
This game.  This friggin' game.

Something that will get your Atari senses a-tinglin', Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a fun little diversion.  The game itself is relatively short, but if you want replay value, this has it in spades.  A random adventure is generated every time you start it up.

Just so you are aware, this game takes historical accuracy very seriously, and while the Conestoga Wagon/International Space Station War of 1883 was indeed a tale worthy of gaming, to make such light of a serious conflict did make me a bit uneasy.

In short, if you want a game to play that's short enough to be played between you playing games, you can always fire up Super Amazing Wagon Adventure and have a ball.  Or invite your friends over, name your party after them, and laugh maniacally while they all die horrible deaths by pixelated proxy.  Up to you.

10890537.review: This is a game that does everything right gameplaywise in the sense that your mistakes are (usually) the only reason you lost health/died, your choices are the only things getting you into sticky situations, and your knowledge and skill at and of the game is the only determining factor in how far you get. You're going to die quickly your first few times, and that's okay. This game is what many NES games were/should have been in the sense that it's not made to be beaten in a day, the same reason Castlevania is such a great game. You have to play it, fail, find out what you did wrong and learn from it, and you'll find yourself improving with every run. This never gets repetitive, as every run is different, with millions upon millions of different sets of events you could find your party going through, and more wagons being unlocked. Which wagon you choose out of your arsenal is up to you, you may choose a faster wagon to dodge projectiles, you may choose a wagon with a better weapon to fight off more enemies, or you may just go with the standard wagon because it's what works best for you. This is a game that lets you play it your way, choosing the path your party takes as you travel through a noticeably stranger 1830-1870's America, bobbing your head to the beat of the excellent soundtrack and giving a satisfied sigh at the NES-era graphics through this game, a game that gets my 10 out of 10.

10890411.review:
The hardy pioneers who traveled west in their covered wagons faced many dangers: weather, dangerous river crossings, bears, narwhals, machine gun bandits, diseased monkeys, lava, malevolent glitches... Now you, too, can experience this historically accurate retelling of how the West was won.

In terms of gameplay, it's a short but replayable, increasingly silly series of mini-games with many variations on shooting and dodging obstacles. I've been laughing enough at even a few minutes' play of this -- four fatal encounters with the above and more -- that I've gotten my money's worth already. You can appreciate this game more if you've played "The Oregon Trail", but it's not necessary.

Niveau graphique, le jeu est en 2D pixellisée ce qui ne plaira pas à tout le monde mais bon, voyez vous même par rapport aux screenshots de la page du magasin. Niveau gameplay, c'est un shoot'em up classique avec une certaine difficulté mine de rien. Au niveau de l'histoire, elle pourra vous paraître se répéter après quelques parties car certains éléments peuvent revenir souvent mais à côté de ça, elle peut facilement partir dans les choses assez inimaginables comme votre wagon qui dérive dans l'espace ou encore que l'un de vos héros se fasse attaquer par une horde d'écureuils furieux. Attention toutefois, le jeu est intégralement en Anglais mais ça reste un vocabulaire facilement accessible. Niveau sonore, le jeu a une bande son absolument GENIALE ! J'ai complètement adoré les musiques de ce jeu qui collent parfaitement à l'ambiance.
En conclusion je dirais que ce jeu est vraiment une expérience unique qui ravira autant les fans de shoot'em up pixelisés que les personnes voulant de l'aléatoire dans leurs jeux. Super Amazing Wagon Adventure est toutefois un jeu qui ne se joue qu'en petites sessions car une partie est assez vite perdue donc ne vous attendez pas à jouer des heures et des heures d'affilés.
Ma note : 8.5/10
Signé le poney noir et violet, Ender Rush.

10858395.review:
Is this game great? No.
Is it fun? For a while.
Is it hard? Artificially, yes. (Undodgeable objects, inability to heal outside of random chance, random drops in health via disease.)
Is it roguelike? Partially. There are random events but only a select few that always occur at the same positions. Example is at the beginning you either get ambushed by Unicorns and fight a dragon or you get ambushed by bandits and fight a machine gun cart. 
Is this game entertaining? For a while, then it gets infuriatingly repetitive and boring as you never quite reach the end due to dumb luck. It would also be nice if the other carts weren't god awful or impossible to unlock. Reward players, don't cripple them when the odds are already stacked against them. 

EDIT: One really great thing about this game is the soundtrack. Even if the game is repetitive the soundtrack is enjoyable every time. The Great Plains music reminds me of the early days of Ninja Sex Party. Also the soundtrack is in the games files with remixes not in the game, so drop it into your music player of choice if you want to listen on the go.

Do I recommend this game? Only on a sale. It is fun and it's a goofy game to introduce to friends. But it's basically a Newgrounds Flash Game, probably won't entertain past an 30min, an hour tops. $3 isn't bad but I've gotten better for free.

10848831.review:
Normally, I would quote "You get what you pay for," since I bought this game for $0.99 during the Summer Sale.  However, since I bought Half-Life on Steam during a sale for $1.99, I think I am entitled to complain.

This game is something you would normally see on a flash games website, good for maybe a half-hour of entertainment before it gets boring.  To make matters worse, all of the wagons need to be unlocked through achievements save for the default one.  It also provides little real challenge other than twitch response in terms of gameplay.  The gameplay consists of being flashed a "random" message, then being thrown into a scenario that usually involves shooting animals, people, or dodging obstacles.  However, after a half-hour of play, I was seeing the same events every other run.  It turns out that the game isn't procedurally generated in the traditional sense, other than the random location of enemy spawns.  There are certain events that are fixed, such as crossing rivers, where the player is presented with a choice on how to do so.  However, most events that have a chance occur are linked to other events that is required to immediately follow, such as burning buffalo during a prairie fire only happens if there was a prarie fire, which only happens if there was a herd of buffalo, which happens every time upon entering the Great Plains level.  So there is actually not much variety in gameplay, since the event generation seems to only be based on two possible outcomes, often y/n, if a --> b ?, or based on player choice.

But I would forgive all of this, even LOVE IT, if the game was just fun to play past the 1 hour mark.  But instead, it becomes a tedious and annoying mess of screen ghosting after that.  Save your ten bucks for something worthwhile.

10820840.review:
I set off with myself, my adopted Jamaican uncle JoJo, and my platonic female friend Sexjoke.

We realize we need food, meat specifically, to keep our spirits hardy during the long journey. We kill countless animals and store their corpses in our wagon, we will eat well...

My company and I come across a legendary beast of old. The magestic yet misleading unicorn. Our feast for flesh knows no limits, so I consider killing the beast for food. I, being the leader, decide otherwise. "No!" I tell my companions. "We shall follow this beast, and see will it takes us!"

Ah unicorns are shifty beasts are they not? The magestic animal had led us into an ambush, and its brothers and sisters charged at us, their horns thirsting for blood. We fend them off and pick up their corpses for meat.

We thought it was over, but suddenly a ferocious cross between a snake, a bird of prey, and a big cat comes out of nowhere to send us to meet our maker. A dragon! It breathes flaming hot fire onto our wagon, burning JoJo and I to death.

Haunting the cart, I watch as Sexjoke valiantly defeats the vile creature. I've never been more proud.

Mourning our deaths, she came across a roaring river, she could ford it, but she could attempt to jump over it.

She chooses the latter, but miraculously survives, only to land in a family of bears, waking them from their slumber.

One of them runs up to Sexjoke and hugs her, the force of said hug causes the poor lady to explode.

Our journey is over, but we unlocked Fiona's wagon from Shrek.

(10/10) Would die again...

Head west young adventurer!

Shoot buffalos and rabbits and turkeys and bees for pelts so you can trade them to a merchant for a flamethrower.  Forget fording the river, you're going swimming watch out for bullet shooting giant squids!  Maybe you'll find a cave filled with giant bats, maybe you'll get poisoned after eating foul meat, you might be attacked by rabid squirrels, you might drink yourself to death trying to purge your memories of the zombie deer invasion yesterday.

This is a game to play for short periods of time and roll with the random events that plague you as you attempt your journey west.  If only Oregon Trail were this fun back when I was a kid.  I wouldn't have learned anything but I would have had a LOT more fun!

Note: the "crt" looking effect can be turned off.

10713983.review:
Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is a game where you create a party of three to ride a wagon to migrate west.  It alternates between a side scroller (when you're in the wagon) and being able to wander around on the screen to acomplish a task (on foot)  Most of the time you're going to be trying to avoid death by shooting various enemies with an assortment of weapons.  But you don't get this game for the gameplay you get it for the story.  While you will figure out the general format after a bit of playing the game will still continue to through curve balls at you.  This game will kill you and your other 2 friends  in ways you never expected such as unicorn magic, UFOs, and your inner demons to name a few.  Be prepared to die a lot.  My only complaint is that there is no mouse sensitivity adjustment, so in game my mouse is has very low sensitivity which is annoying.  Fortunatly the game can be played with only a keybord and doesn't require a mouse.

9.6/10

10282322.review:
Cheap, funny, and suprisingly challenging.

Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is Oregon Trail meets WarioWare as a scrolling shoot 'em up. Essentially you are thrown into a variety of bizzare scenarios where you shoot and dodge stuff for about 30 seconds or less, and then there's a short transition and you're suddenly somewhere else shooting and/or dodging other stuff. For example, you might be crossing a river dodging boulders, and then you'll make it across the river and into the prairie where you'll gun down some buffalo. The general order of events never changes (forest-->river-->plains-->desert/second river-->mountain-->freefall-->rapids/present day) but there are special random events that can occur, including everything from unicorns to time travel to pirates, many of which will unlock new wagons.

SAWA is really fun, but also difficult. I've only completed it once, and I had to use the invisible wagon, which has a super tiny hitbox. Thankfully it has a good sense of humor and charming visuals and music to ease the pain of my many, many deaths.

8/10 Would [strike] BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO[/strike] buy again

9554773.review: I do like this game. Its humour fits my taste like a glove most of the time. Now don't be fooled by the rather simplistic atmosphere. This isn't just some Oregon Trail clone. It is, however, perfectly historically accurate, for the most part. In real life, women in red dresses don't go walking around alone in the great plains, but other than that, this game is accurate. It's got everything except Indian attacks. Bank robberies, train robberies, bandits, hunting, buffalo, buffalo, water buffalo, llamas, alligators, bears, sharks, cobras, mummies, cars, and sheriffs arresting you for all of your arson, murder, and jaywalking. But if you get to the end, you'll feel like the ultimate bad ass.

7986276.review:
Super Amazing Wagon Adventure (Devs... calmatevi con i nomi. asd) è un giochino indie parecchio divertente con una ogni volta randomizzata che vi porrà davanti a situazioni piuttosto improbabili e ridicole nel selvaggio West!

Inizierete (ovviamente) con l'avviare il gioco, per procedere con la creazione (o la randomizzazione) dei vostri tre avventurieri nei minimi dettagli. Subito dopo verrete catapultati in una storia OGNI volta randomizzata (anche se costituita sempre da un inizio pressochè uguale e con, in certi punti, un pò di eventi programmati) narrata da carismatiche frasi scritte in bianco pixellato in uno sfondo completamente nero. Potrebbe succedervi qualsiasi cosa durante il vostro viaggio narrato narrato in giorni come unità di misura, tra cui prendere delle scelte, assaggiare dei funghi allucinogeni e morire uccisi da ragni giganti immaginari, essere inseguiti da banditi a causa delle grossi scorte di cibo, andare a caccia, ed altro ancora!

Una volta finita la modalità campagna si sbloccherà una modalità infinita, una sorta di ''survival'' con punteggio record. Oltre a ciò il gioco dispone anche di varie altre carovane sbloccabili, completando obbiettivi sinceramente non troppo chiari.

Il comparto grafico è molto, MOOOOLTO pixelloso, e magari a qualcuno non potrebbe piacere. Il comparto audio è particolare anch'esso, e come longevità potrei dire che è ottima, se non vi stufate. In particolare visto il suo prezzo ridicolo, una grafica per alcuni eccessivamente pixellosa, non può di certo farvi perdere un'idea carina ed originale, pensata e programmata bene, fondando così un videogame con un gameplay ricco, coinvolgente, ed esilarante.

Credo sia da provare almeno una volta nella vita da buon indie-gamer (quindi ogni utente steam, in pratica) che si rispetti.

Un MUST BUY insomma!
