7914202.review:
Super Amazing Wagon Adventure is hilarious! I find that very few games put me into fits of belly laughter, this is one of those few games that did just that. Super Amazing Wagon Adventure combines 2D side scrolling shooting, peppered with the occasional Robotron style shooter, all wrapped up into an adventure that's different on every playthrough. Obviously this is the game's main hook, and part of the reason why the game is so hilarious. You just can't write shit like that in real life, Super Amazing Wagon Adventure doesn't even need to try... Seriously, upon my first playthrough, I named my three adventurers (two of them being my best friends and housemates), the games randomly generated story decided that I was going to contract purple fever, help save a train from being hijacked, fall in love with one of my partners (who just happens to be my best mate), "relieve ourselves" in the wagon, all before we all died outrunning an erupting volcano, whilst dodging wolves that were on fire.... Amazing!

Oh, and there's an awesome chiptune-ish soundtrack and a gorgeous TV scanline effect, mimicking the asthetics of the old Atari 7800 games. Loads of fun, hard as hell, and hilarious as fuck, highly recommend this one!

7827398.review:
I didn't have fun for long with this game. It feels just like it lacks a lot in gameplay, as things are just greatly difficult to accomplish and in the beginning you just depend on your luck if you want to get far.
It's biggest sale point, the randomness of events is... not really that big. Yes, there is a variety of things that can happen to you, but it seems to like there isn't really that much variety.
You always follow a specific basic path, which then has several options of what could happen to you. Sometimes, you can make the decision, like jumping or fording a river, which basically means having the chance for a random event, like having to dodge bees or asteroids. The other decision will have you... dodge... boulders.
If you play it and then die and play it again, you will soon realize that there isn't really that much variety in what will happen to you. And, because the game sometimes just throws undodgeable obstacles in your way, faster than a human being could possibly react to, dying will happen to you a lot.
Also you seem to be very limited in what you can do. The weapons, which the game will not really let you choose to fire it or conserve it, always have very limited ammo. You have, if you coun't all the party members, 12 points of health, from which the game sometimes RANDOMLY decides to take a quarter away. You either heal from (quickly appearing) health pickups or from random events.
The game has a real good soundtrack though, and the design is mostly nice to look at, the sound effects also appear to be fitting and they don't get annoying.
The text "scrolling", which is not in your hand, even on the fastest setting, was still too slow for me. Why not let me decide when to skip the text?

In conclusion, the game has some sort of variety and the random events are funny at first, but they get old quickly. The gameplay doesn't have much variety, where I would really have appreciated to put more effort in. It doesn't cost a lot, so it doesn't really hurt to try it out, but I for myself, did not pull a lot of enjoyment out of it.

7768206.review:
No game makes me smile the way that Super Amazing Wagon Adventure does.

The love that went into making this game -- by a one-person studio, no less -- is evident from the moment that the title screen is displayed.

At first glace, the lo-fi visual style is deceptively simple. But as you experience each new scenario, the passion and care that went into creating this specific experience becomes more and more evident.

Those visuals are supported by a soundtrack that is simply a joy to listen to. Each phase of the wagon's journey has an overall theme that effectively sets the mood. When the final track begins, the anticipation of reaching the coast is palpable.

PLAY THIS GAME

7471209.review:
This game is pretty fucking super amazing.  So, I died on the first day of traveling, which left Uche and Maya to do the rest of the journey without me.  They accidentally entered low Earth-orbit while trying to jump over the river, and they blew up the international space station.  Uche was then gored by a buffalo and died slowly and painfully from internal bleeding.  Maya made it to the mountain passes, where she managed to fight off droves of ninjas with an ancient sword, slashing them and deflecting their ninja throwing stars.  She got then got distracted and accidentally drove off of a cliff, where she was attacked by eagles, which she slashed through with her ancient weapon.  After landing in another river, she almost immediately got shot by bandits in a paddle boat.  Imagine the reactions I got when I told this story to them at school.

If that doesn't convince you to buy this game, then you have no soul and I will personally slice you in half with an ancient katana and then trample on your dead body while riding a buffalo.

Fuck Organ Trail, this is the best travelling-in-a-wagon sim you're going to find on Steam. Great sense of humor, silly unlocks for some alternate gameplay styles, it's randomized out the ass, and does the kind of things you wanted to as a kid.

When you first get to a river and are asked "ford it" or "jump it", you'll know what you're getting in for. Or when the road turns into a highway and you're dodging cars.

In fact: this is Warioware: Oregon Trail. That sums this up pretty well.
